module.p: a(i)n- is a negative or intensifying compounding prefix.

an- as noun-compounding prefix –
luchd load, burden ⇒ an-luchd oppressive burden (cf. an-luchdaich overload, overburden)

ana- as noun-compounding prefix –
buille beat ⇒ ana-bhuille syncopation, syncope
cainnt speech ⇒ ana-cainnt verbal abuse, abusive speech
cleas trick ⇒ ana-cleas wicked deed
cothrom opportunity, fairness ⇒ ana-cothrom unfairness, adversity, disadvantage (also anacothram, cf. mì-chothrom imbalance, unfairness)
miann desire ⇒ ana-miann lust

ain- as noun-compounding prefix –
ceàrd metalsmith ⇒ aincheard buffoon, wag (also an-cheaird(each))
ceist question ⇒ aincheist puzzle, riddle
cinealtas clannishness ⇒ ainchinealtas racism (cf. ainchinealtach racist)
deòin assent, will ⇒ aindeoin reluctance
dlighe godly, religious ⇒ ain-dlighe injustice (also aindlighe, cf. mì-dhligheach illegal)
eòl knowledge ⇒ aineol foreigner, stranger, unfamiliarity, strangeness
fiach value, debt ⇒ ainfhiach debt
fios knowledge ⇒ ainfhios ignorance
mèin character, disposition ⇒ ain-mèin fury, rage (also ainmein, ain-mèinn)
neart strength ⇒ ainneart violence
riaghailt rule, government ⇒ ain-riaghailt anarchy (also mì-riaghailt chaos, misrule)
teas heat ⇒ ainteas inflammation, fervour
tighearna lord ⇒ aintighearna despot, tyrant

aim- as noun-compounding prefix –
beart instrument, fact ⇒ aimbeart need, necessity

aimh- as noun-compounding prefix –
leas advantage, benefit ⇒ aimhleas mischief
riar will, inclination ⇒ aimhriar inconsistency (also aimh-rèir)
rèite agreement ⇒ aimhreit discord, unrest

ana- as adjective-compounding prefix –
biorach sharp, pointed ⇒ ana-bhiorach very sharp, very pointed (cf. ana-bhiorach [noun] centipede)
blasta tasty ⇒ ana-bhlasta delicious
mòr big, large ⇒ ana-mhòr huge, immense, enormous, excessive (also an-mhòr)

ain- as adjective-compounding prefix –
diadhaidh godly, religious ⇒ ain-diadhaidh godless, irreligious

aimh- as adjective-compounding prefix –
leathann broad, wide ⇒ aimhleathann narrow

ana- as verb-compounding prefix –
caith spend, consume ⇒ ana-caith misuse, waste, over-consume (cf. ana-cai(th)teach extravagant, ana-caitheamh extravagance)
